snippet: The Committee to Protect Journalists said that the number of detentions of journalists in the country is at its highest point since 1991.
abstract: Human rights activists and press freedom organizations report Egyptian government has ramped up its crackdown on news media with arrest of prominent journalist Ismail Iskandarani and upcoming trial of photojournalist Mahmoud Abou Zeid.

byline.original: By AMINA ISMAIL and DECLAN WALSH

lead_paragraph: The Committee to Protect Journalists said that the number of detentions of journalists in the country is at its highest point since 1991.

headline.main: Egypt Is Intensifying Its Crackdown on Journalists, Rights Group Warns
headline.print_headline: Egypt Is Intensifying Its Crackdown on Journalists, Rights Group Warns

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
